page.title: 03 Water transport Otterham
page.content: Otterham Creek branching souhwards from the main estuary receives water borne trade from many parts of the world.Much of this trade is in forest products such as woodpulp and paper. Most of the vessels using the creek are "LASH" lighters,non powered barges designed to be carried across oceans aboard large ships then dropped into the water at the mouths of estuaries to be towed to the final destination by tugs. During the last month (July '85) the creek received 1 vessel carrying bulk starch, 2 carrying newsprint and one "LASH" vessel.
